description: Fired FTC Commissioners Rebecca Slaughter and Alvaro Bedoya raised urgent concerns about the Trump administration's 'Department of Government Efficiency' (DOGE) gaining potential access to confidential merger files and nonpublic business data, which could be exploited to manipulate markets or benefit specific corporate interests.

sources.title: Fired US Federal Trade Commissioners concerned about DOGE data access
Federal trade commissioners alarmed as Elon Musk's team seeks antitrust records
Federal trade commissioners alarmed as Musk's team seeks antitrust records

summary: Democratic FTC Commissioners Slaughter and Bedoya warned that the Trump administration's 'Department of Government Efficiency' (DOGE) was seeking access to highly sensitive, confidential business records that could potentially manipulate markets. They emphasized that under no circumstances should DOGE be permitted to access this data, highlighting a significant regulatory capture attempt.
title: Fired US Federal Trade Commissioners Sound Alarm on Potential Data Access Misuse
notes: Event from comprehensive kleptocracy timeline tracking.
